label: Petition from Hugh Rose to the St. Andrew's Society
description: Petition of Hugh Rose to the St. Andrew's Society requesting assistance, claiming that he is destitute after his sizeable crops were stolen by enslaved Africans and destroyed by bears.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Petition of Hugh Rose to the St. Andrew's Society requesting assistance, claiming that he is destitute after his sizeable crops were stolen by enslaved Africans and destroyed by bears.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information contact Special Collections, College of Charleston Libraries, 66 George St., Charleston SC 29401.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 300 dpi, 24-bit depth, color. Epson Expression 10000XL. Archival masters are tiffs.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
The Memoreall [memorial] of Hugh Rose to the Honorored [Honored] John Siland Esq President of the Sant [Saint] Andrews Cloub [club] and to all the Honorored Members of the Said Sosiety [Society]
 
Most Humbly Sheweth That I have been suplyed [supplied] by your Honororers [Honors] this two years bygon [bygone] and was Resolved not give your Honoror's any more trouble by having the Misfortoun [misfortune] after Making as great a Crop as Manie [many] in the Provance [province] in Preportion [proportion] to what Land I Labored to have it Distroyed [destroyed] by Bears and Stoln [stolen] by Niggro's [sic] I am in my Seventy on years of my ayge [age] and Lives in a Hut and Labors for my Living as a Niggro [sic] and has not neathour [neither] fleshes not Liquer but the vegatives of the Ground to Live by and am Satisfied with the Same until it pleas [pleases] God to make my Living beter [better]

Your Honoror's Memorealist Most Humbly beggs [begs] you may take in to Consideration the Premessess [premises] of this my Memoriall and order for me what Charety [charity] your Honorors may judge Proper for to Suply [supply] my Necesetys [necessities] and ever prays as in deuty [duty] to God to bless and Prosper your Honoror and the Members of the Soscyety [society] and am in Sincerety and Humilety [humility]

Your Honorors

Most Humble
